Name: Adaptability
Game_Description: Powers up moves of the same type as the Pokémon.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases the Same Type Attack Bonus from *1.5 to *2.

Name: Aerilate
Game_Description: Normal-type moves become Flying-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases the power of Normal-type moves by 20%. It then changes those moves to Flying-type.

Name: Aftermath
Game_Description: Damages the attacker if it contacts the Pokémon with a finishing hit.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The foe that dealt the final hit loses 1/4 of its maximum HP if the move made physical contact.

Name: Air Lock
Game_Description: Eliminates the effects of weather.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: All weather effects are negated while the Pokémon is on the field.

Name: Analytic
Game_Description: Boosts move power when the Pokémon moves last.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Attack power increases by 30% if the Pokémon is the last Pokémon to attack this turn.

Name: Anger Point
Game_Description: The Pokémon is angered when it takes a critical hit, and that maxes its Attack stat.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases Attack to maximum level upon taking a critical hit.

Name: Anticipation
Game_Description: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Warns when the foe knows 1-hit KO or super-effective moves.

Name: Arena Trap
Game_Description: Prevents opposing Pokémon from fleeing.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The opponent cannot run nor switch. Flying-type Pokémon and Pokémon with the Levitate special ability are unaffected. If this Pokémon switches, the opponent is still trapped for that turn. The opponent may still switch by using Baton Pass.

Name: Aroma Veil
Game_Description: Protects allies from attacks that limit their move choices.

Name: Aura Break
Game_Description: Reduces power of Dark- and Fairy-type moves.

Name: Bad Dreams
Game_Description: Reduces a sleeping foe's HP.

Name: Ball Fetch
Game_Description: If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the Poké Ball from the first failed throw of the battle.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Retrieves a Poké Ball from a failed throw.

Name: Battery
Game_Description: Powers up ally Pokémon's special moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Boosts Ally Pokémon's Special Attack by 30%.

Name: Battle Armor
Game_Description: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Opponent’s moves cannot Critical Hit.

Name: Battle Bond
Game_Description: Transform into Ash-Greninja after causing opponent to faint.

Name: Beast Boost
Game_Description: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases the Pokémon's highest stat when it knocks out a Pokémon.

Name: Berserk
Game_Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Sp. Atk stat when it takes a hit that causes its HP to become half or less.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Raises Special Attack when HP drops below half.

Name: Big Pecks
Game_Description: Protects the Pokémon from Defense-lowering attacks.

Name: Blaze
Game_Description: Powers up Fire-type moves in a pinch.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When HP is below 1/3rd its maximum, power of Fire-type moves is increased by 50%.

Name: Bulletproof
Game_Description: Protects the Pokémon from ball and bomb moves.

Name: Cheek Pouch
Game_Description: Restores additional HP when a Berry is consumed.

Name: Chlorophyll
Game_Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in sunshine.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When sunny, the Pokémon’s Speed doubles.

Name: Clear Body
Game_Description: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Opponents’ moves which lower this Pokémon’s stats have no effect. However this Pokémon may lower its own stats with its own moves.

Name: Cloud Nine
Game_Description: Eliminates the effects of weather.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: All weather effects are negated while the Pokémon is on the field.

Name: Color Change
Game_Description: The Pokémon's type becomes the type of the move used on it.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: This Pokémon’s type becomes the type of the last damaging move which hit it.

Name: Comatose
Game_Description: It's always drowsing and will never wake up. It can attack without waking up.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: It acts as if it is affected by the Sleep status condition. All special effects of moves based on the Sleep status condition affect this Pokémon such as Snore & Sleep Talk working from the Pokémon with Comatose and double damage from Hex & Wake-up Slap, Dream Eater & Nightmare and even abilities such as Bad Dreams will activate. This Pokémon can still attack.

Name: Competitive
Game_Description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat sharply when a stat is lowered.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Raises Sp. Atk stat by two stages whenever a stat is lowered.

Name: Compound Eyes
Game_Description: The Pokémon's compound eyes boost its accuracy.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Raises the Pokémon’s accuracy by 30%.

Name: Contrary
Game_Description: Makes stat changes have an opposite effect.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Moves used on the Pokémon that raise stats lower the stats, while the moves that lower the stats raise the stat.

Name: Corrosion
Game_Description: The Pokémon can poison the target even if it's a Steel or Poison type.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon can poison Steel and Poison types.

Name: Cotton Down
Game_Description: When the Pokémon is hit by an attack, it scatters cotton fluff around and lowers the Speed stat of all Pokémon except itself.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Lowers foe's Speed when hit.

Name: Cursed Body
Game_Description: May disable a move used on the Pokémon.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When a move hits the Pokémon, that move has a 30% chance of getting disabled.

Name: Cute Charm
Game_Description: Contact with the Pokémon may cause infatuation.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The opponent has a 30% chance of being induced with Attract when using an attack, that requires physical contact, against this Pokémon.

Name: Damp
Game_Description: Prevents the use of explosive moves such as Self-Destruct by dampening its surroundings.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Explosion, Selfdestruct & Mind Blown will not work while the Pokémon is on the field.

Name: Dancer
Game_Description: When another Pokémon uses a dance move, it can use a dance move following it regardless of its Speed.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Copies the foe's Dance moves.

Name: Dark Aura
Game_Description: Powers up each Pokémon's Dark-type moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Raises power of Dark type moves for all Pokémon in battle by 33.3%.

Name: Dauntless Shield
Game_Description: Boosts Defense in battle.

Name: Dazzling
Game_Description: Surprises the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Protects the Pokémon from high-priority moves.

Name: Defeatist
Game_Description: Halves the Pokémon's Attack and Sp. Atk stats when its HP becomes half or less.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Lowers stats when HP drops below half.

Name: Defiant
Game_Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat sharply when its stats are lowered.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Attack is raised by two stages when the Pokémon has its stats lowered. Doesn't work on self inflicted stat drops or drops from allies.

Name: Delta Stream
Game_Description: The Pokémon changes the weather to eliminate all of the Flying type's weaknesses.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Creates the Strong Winds weather. This lasts until the Pokémon exits battle, and weakens moves used on Flying-type Pokémon that would be Super Effective.

Name: Desolate Land
Game_Description: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Water-type attacks.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Creates the Strong Sun weather. This lasts until the Pokémon exits battle, and renders Water-type moves useless.

Name: Disguise
Game_Description: Once per battle, the shroud that covers the Pokémon can protect it from an attack
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Once per battle, the Pokémon can withstand one damaging attack without receiving any damage. Damage inflicted through entry hazards, weather or status conditions will not break the disguise. Damage from Confusion will break the Disguise. It causes 1/8th of max Hit Point damage when it breaks.

Name: Download
Game_Description: Compares an opposing Pokémon's Defense and Sp. Def stats before raising its own Attack or Sp. Atk statâ€”whichever will be more effective.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Attack is increased when the foe’s Defense is lower than its Special Defense or increases Special Attack when the foe’s Special Defense is lower than its Defense.

Name: Drizzle
Game_Description: The Pokémon makes it rain when it enters a battle.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Weather changes to Heavy Rain when the Pokémon enters the battle. As of X & Y, this lasts 5 turns.

Name: Drought
Game_Description: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokémon enters a battle.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Weather changes to Intense Sunshine when the Pokémon enters the battle. As of X & Y, this lasts 5 turns.

Name: Dry Skin
Game_Description: Restores HP in rain or when hit by Water-type moves. Reduces HP in sunshine, and increases the damage received from Fire-type moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: HP is restored when hit by Water-type moves or when it is raining but also makes the Pokémon weak to Fire-type moves and reduces HP during strong sunlight.

Name: Early Bird
Game_Description: The Pokémon awakens twice as fast as other Pokémon from sleep.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Sleep conditions lasts for half as long, rounding down. For example, half of three turns is 1.5, which rounds down to one turn. When the number of turns to sleep is one, half of this rounded down is zero, and the Pokémon wakes up instantly.

Name: Effect Spore
Game_Description: Contact with the Pokémon may inflict poison, sleep, or paralysis on its attacker.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The opponent has a 10% chance of being induced by PARALYZE, POISON, or SLEEP when using an attack, that requires physical contact, against this Pokémon.

Name: Electric Surge
Game_Description: Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Activates Electric Terrain for 5 turns when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Emergency Exit
Game_Description: The Pokémon, sensing danger, switches out when its HP becomes half or less.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When the Pokémon's Hit Points hit 50% or less, the Pokémon will switch out. Works once per battle. The Pokémon will not switch out if it drops below 50% due to Confusion, Weather, use of Substitute or when the damage inflicted is by a Pokémon with the Sheer Force ability. It will not activate if health is brought back up above 50% due to a hold item.

Name: Fairy Aura
Game_Description: Powers up each Pokémon's Fairy-type moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Raises power of Fairy type moves for all Pokémon in battle by 33.3%.

Name: Filter
Game_Description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Damage by super-effective moves is reduced by 25%.

Name: Flame Body
Game_Description: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The opponent has a 30% chance of being induced with Burn when using an attack, that requires physical contact, against this Pokémon.

Name: Flare Boost
Game_Description: Powers up special attacks when the Pokémon burned.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Special Attack stat increased by 50% when burned.

Name: Flash Fire
Game_Description: Powers up the Pokémon's Fire-type moves if it's hit by one.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Activates when user is hit by a damaging Fire-type move (including Fire-type Hidden Power). Once activated, user’s Fire-type moves deal 1.5 times damage. While this ability is in effect, this Pokémon is immune to damage from Fire-type attacks and Fire-type Hidden Power (accuracy and effect from these moves are ignored). For Fire-type Pokémon with this ability, Will-O-Wisp activates this ability without having an effect. If a non-Fire-type Pokémon has this ability, Will-O-Wisp will activate the ability and will have an effect.

Name: Flower Gift
Game_Description: Boosts the Attack and Sp. Def stats of itself and allies when it is sunny.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Ally’s Attack and Special Defence are multiplied by 1.5 during strong sunlight.

Name: Flower Veil
Game_Description: Ally Grass-type Pokémon are protected from status conditions and the lowering of their stats.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Prevents lowering of ally Grass-type Pokémon's stats.

Name: Fluffy
Game_Description: Halves the damage taken from moves that make direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves.

Name: Forecast
Game_Description: The Pokémon transforms with the weather to change its type to Water, Fire, or Ice.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: This Pokémon’ changes its form and type if Harsh Sunlight, Heavy Rain or Hail is in effect.

Name: Forewarn
Game_Description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can tell one of the moves an opposing Pokémon has.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Reveals the foe’s strongest move.

Name: Friend Guard
Game_Description: Reduces damage done to allies.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: In Double & Triple battles, the damage that ally Pokémon receive from attacks is reduced by 25%.

Name: Frisk
Game_Description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Reveals the foe’s held item.

Name: Full Metal Body
Game_Description: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

Name: Fur Coat
Game_Description: Halves the damage from physical moves onto this Pokémon.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Reduces damage from physical moves by 50%.

Name: Gale Wings
Game_Description: Gives priority to Flying-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is full.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: All Flying-type moves have their Speed Priority increased by 1 if the Pokémon's Hit Points are at maximum.

Name: Galvanize
Game_Description: Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: ncreases the power of Normal-type moves by 20%. It then changes those moves to Electric-type.

Name: Gluttony
Game_Description: Makes the Pokémon eat a held Berry when its HP drops to half or less, which is sooner than usual.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon will use a berry when its Hit Points are below 50%.

Name: Gooey
Game_Description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Lowers the opponent's Speed by one stage when it makes physical contact.

Name: Gorilla Tactics
Game_Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat but only allows the use of the first selected move.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Raises the Pokémon's Attack stat by one stage, but locks the Pokémon into using the first attack it uses after being sent out.

Name: Grass Pelt
Game_Description: Boosts the Defense stat in Grassy Terrain.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases Defense by 50% when battling on Grass or if the move Grassy Terrain is in effect.

Name: Grassy Surge
Game_Description: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Activates Grassy Terrain for 5 turns when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Gulp Missile
Game_Description: When the Pokémon uses Surf or Dive, it will come back with prey. When it takes damage, it will spit out the prey to attack.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When using Surf or Dive, it will change into Gulping Form if it has over 50% max HP or Gorging Form if it has less than 50% max HP. If hit afterwards, form reverts and it shoots out its prey to attack, doing 1/4th of opponent's maximum HP in damage. If the Cramorant was in Gulping Form, the opponent's Defense is lowered 1 stage. If the Cramorant was in Gorging Form, the opponent is paralyzed.

Name: Guts
Game_Description: It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Attack is increased by 50% when induced with a status (BURN, PARALYZE, SLEEP, POISON, FREEZE). Burn’s effect of lowering Attack is not applied.

Name: Harvest
Game_Description: May create another Berry after one is used.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon has a 50% chance of restoring a consumed berry. During sunshine, this chance increases to 100%

Name: Healer
Game_Description: Sometimes heals an ally's status condition.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: At the end of the turn, there is a 30% chance of either Ally being healed from a status condition

Name: Heatproof
Game_Description: The heatproof body of the Pokémon halves the damage from Fire-type moves that hit it.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Damage from Fire-type moves and the Burn status is halved.

Name: Heavy Metal
Game_Description: Doubles the Pokémon's weight.

Name: Honey Gather
Game_Description: The Pokémon may gather Honey after a battle.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: May pick up a Honey after battle; the higher the level, the higher the chance.

Name: Huge Power
Game_Description: Doubles the Pokémon's Attack stat.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon's Attack stat is doubled while it has this ability.

Name: Hunger Switch
Game_Description: The Pokémon changes its form, alternating between its Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode after the end of each turn.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Changes forms each turn.

Name: Hustle
Game_Description: Boosts the Attack stat, but lowers accuracy.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Damage from physical attacks is increased by 50%, but average accuracy is only 80%.

Name: Hydration
Game_Description: Heals status conditions if it's raining.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: All status problems: Burn, Paralysis, Sleep, Frozen and Poison, are healed when raining.

Name: Hyper Cutter
Game_Description: The Pokémon's proud of its powerful pincers. They prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Opponent cannot lower this Pokémon’s Attack value. This Pokémon may still lower its own Attack value using a move of by itself.

Name: Ice Body
Game_Description: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in a hailstorm.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: HP is restored by 1/16th of maximum HP when its hailing.

Name: Ice Face
Game_Description: The Pokémon's ice head can take a physical attack as a substitute, but the attack also changes the Pokémon's appearance. The ice will be restored when it hails.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Has a protective barrier that protects against Physical Attacks once and will change form to Noice Face after breaking. Confusion also breaks the barrier. Setting Hail or being sent out during hail will restore the Ice Face and change form to Ice Face.

Name: Ice Scales
Game_Description: The Pokémon is protected by ice scales, which halve the damage taken from special moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Halves damage from Special moves.

Name: Illuminate
Game_Description: Raises the likelihood of meeting wild Pokémon by illuminating the surroundings.

Name: Illusion
Game_Description: Comes out disguised as the Pokémon in the party's last spot.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When sent out into battle, it takes the name and appearance of the last non-fainted Pokémon within your party. It breaks when an attack does damage on the Pokémon but not from Weather Effects or Entry Hazards.

Name: Immunity
Game_Description: The immune system of the Pokémon prevents it from getting poisoned.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon cannot be Poisoned while having this ability.

Name: Imposter
Game_Description: The Pokémon transforms itself into the Pokémon it's facing.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When sent into battle, the Pokémon automatically transforms into a random opponent that is on the field.

Name: Infiltrator
Game_Description: Passes through the opposing Pokémon's barrier, substitute, and the like and strikes.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The protections and stat boosts caused by the moves Substitute, Reflect, Light Screen and Safeguard by the opponent are ignored.

Name: Innards Out
Game_Description: Damages the attacker landing the finishing hit by the amount equal to its last HP.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Deals damage upon fainting.

Name: Inner Focus
Game_Description: The Pokémon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: This Pokémon will not flinch. Does not prevent flinching with Focus Punch. Also prevents stats from being lowered by the ability Intimidate.

Name: Insomnia
Game_Description: The Pokémon is suffering from insomnia and cannot fall asleep.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon cannot be put to Sleep while having this ability.

Name: Intimidate
Game_Description: The Pokémon intimidates opposing Pokémon upon entering battle, lowering their Attack stat.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Upon entering battle, the opponent’s Attack lowers one stage. In a Double Battle, both opponents’ Attack are lowered. Pokémon with the Clear Body, Hyper Cutter, or White Smoke ability are unaffected. In a link battle, if both sides switch on the same turn, and first player sends out a Pokémon with Intimidate, the opponent’s Attack will be lowered before the opponent’s Pokémon switches.

Name: Intrepid Sword
Game_Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat when the Pokémon enters a battle.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Boosts Attack in battle.

Name: Iron Barbs
Game_Description: Inflicts damage to the attacker on contact with iron barbs.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: If physical contact is made on this Pokémon, the opponent will receive damage equal to 1/8th of its maximum HP.

Name: Iron Fist
Game_Description: Powers up punching moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The power of punching moves is increased by 20%.

Name: Justified
Game_Description: Being hit by a Dark-type move boosts the Attack stat of the Pokémon, for justice.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Attack is raised by one stage when the Pokémon is hit by a Dark-type move.

Name: Keen Eye
Game_Description: Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this Pokémon's accuracy.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Opponent cannot lower this Pokémon’s accuracy. The Pokémon ignores evasion boosts of the opponent.

Name: Klutz
Game_Description: The Pokémon can't use any held items.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon cannot receive any effect of hold items except those that affect experience such as Exp.Share or Macho Brace.

Name: Leaf Guard
Game_Description: Prevents status conditions in sunny weather.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Prevents the Pokémon from being afflicted by status conditions during strong sunlight.

Name: Levitate
Game_Description: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Damage dealing Ground-type moves have no effect on this Pokémon. Cannot be trapped by Arena Trap ability. Takes no damage from Spikes.

Name: Libero
Game_Description: Changes the Pokémon's type to the type of the move it's about to use.

Name: Light Metal
Game_Description: Halves the Pokémon's weight.

Name: Lightning Rod
Game_Description: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves. Instead of being hit by Electric-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Electric-type moves are drawn to this Pokémon. Electric-type moves will do no damage and the Pokémon's SP ATK is raised one stage.

Name: Limber
Game_Description: Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon cannot be Paralysed while having this ability.

Name: Liquid Ooze
Game_Description: Oozed liquid has strong stench, which damages attackers using any draining move.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When the opponent absorbs Hit Points from this Pokémon, the opponent instead loses Hit Points.

Name: Liquid Voice
Game_Description: All sound-based moves become Water-type moves.

Name: Long Reach
Game_Description: The Pokémon uses its moves without making contact with the target.

Name: Magic Bounce
Game_Description: Reflects status moves, instead of getting hit by them.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Reflects non-attacking moves used on the Pokémon back to the attacking Pokémon.

Name: Magic Guard
Game_Description: The Pokémon only takes damage from attacks.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Prevents all damage except from direct-attack moves.

Name: Magician
Game_Description: The Pokémon steals the held item of a Pokémon it hits with a move.

Name: Magma Armor
Game_Description: The Pokémon is covered with hot magma, which prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: This Pokémon cannot be Frozen while having this ability.

Name: Magnet Pull
Game_Description: Prevents Steel-type Pokémon from escaping using its magnetic force.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Steel types cannot run nor switch while this Pokémon is in battle. Because the opponent’s switching is blocked, the opponent cannot switch on the turn this Pokémon switches out of battle. The opponent may still switch with Baton Pass.

Name: Marvel Scale
Game_Description: The Pokémon's marvelous scales boost the Defense stat if it has a status condition.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Defense is increased by 50% when induced with a status (BURN, PARALYZE, SLEEP, POISON, FREEZE).

Name: Mega Launcher
Game_Description: Powers up aura and pulse moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases the power of Aura and Pulse moves by 50%.

Name: Merciless
Game_Description: The Pokémon's attacks become critical hits if the target is poisoned.

Name: Mimicry
Game_Description: Changes the Pokémon's type depending on the terrain.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Changes to Electric-type in Electric Terrain, Psychic-type in Psychic Terrain, Grass-type in Grassy Terrain and Fairy type in Fairy-terrain. The type reverts to normal when the terrain ends.

Name: Minus
Game_Description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When battling with Plus or Minus, Special Attack increases by 50%.

Name: Mirror Armor
Game_Description: Bounces back only the stat-lowering effects that the Pokémon receives.

Name: Misty Surge
Game_Description: Turns the ground into Misty Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Activates Misty Terrain for 5 turns when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Mold Breaker
Game_Description: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon's moves are not affected by foe’s abilities during battle.

Name: Moody
Game_Description: Raises one stat sharply and lowers another every turn.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: At the end of every turn, a random stat (except Accuracy and Evasion) is raised by two stages while another is lowered by one stage.

Name: Motor Drive
Game_Description: Boosts its Speed stat if hit by an Electric-type move, instead of taking damage.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon takes no damage from Electric-type attacks and Speed raises by one level.

Name: Moxie
Game_Description: The Pokémon shows moxie, and that boosts the Attack stat after knocking out any Pokémon.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Attack is raised by one stage when the Pokémon knocks out another Pokémon.

Name: Multiscale
Game_Description: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes when its HP is full.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Reduces damage afflicted to the Pokémon by 50% if at maximum HP.

Name: Multitype
Game_Description: Changes the Pokémon's type to match the Plate or Z-Crystal it holds.

Name: Mummy
Game_Description: Contact with this Pokémon  changes the attacker's Ability to Mummy.

Name: Natural Cure
Game_Description: All status conditions heal when the Pokémon switches out.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon’s status (BURN, PARALYZE, SLEEP, POISON, FREEZE) is healed when withdrawn from battle.

Name: Neuroforce
Game_Description: Increases the power of supereffective attacks.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases the power of Super Effective moves used by this Pokémon by 20%.

Name: Neutralizing Gas
Game_Description: If the Pokémon with Neutralizing Gas is in the battle, the effects of all Pokémon's Abilities will be nullified or will not be triggered.

Name: No Guard
Game_Description: The Pokémon employs no-guard tactics to ensure incoming and outgoing attacks always land.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The accuracy of all moves known by this Pokémon and all Pokémon targeting this Pokémon raises to 100%.

Name: Normalize
Game_Description: All the Pokémon's moves become Normal type. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: All moves known by the Pokémon turn into Normal-type and have a boost in power of 20%.

Name: Oblivious
Game_Description: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon cannot be under the Attract condition, Intimidated, or be taunted, while having this ability.

Name: Overcoat
Game_Description: Protects the Pokémon from things like sand, hail, and powder.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Protects Pokémon from Weather Effects and Powder moves such as Sleep Powder, Poison Powder etc.

Name: Overgrow
Game_Description: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When HP is below 1/3rd its maximum, power of Grass-type moves is increased by 50%.

Name: Own Tempo
Game_Description: This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon cannot be Confused while having this ability. Blocks Intimidate.

Name: Parental Bond
Game_Description: Parent and child each attacks.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Every move used by the Pokémon will hit twice. The damage inflicted by the second hit is reduced to 25%. If the move used is a damaging move, each hit is capable of afflicting Secondary Effects and Critical Hits.

Name: Pastel Veil
Game_Description: Protects the Pokémon and its ally Pokémon from being poisoned.

Name: Perish Body
Game_Description: When hit by a move that makes direct contact, the Pokémon and the attacker will faint after three turns unless they switch out of battle.

Name: Pickpocket
Game_Description: Steals an item from an attacker that made direct contact.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When a Pokémon makes physical contact with the Pokémon, the item of the opponent is stolen.

Name: Pickup
Game_Description: The Pokémon may pick up the item an opposing Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Has a 10% chance of finding and holding an item after battle. Will not work if this Pokémon is already holding an item. From Black & White, it allows for the user to pick up the item of its opponent or ally if they used up the item in battle.

Name: Pixilate
Game_Description: Normal-type moves become Fairy-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases the power of Normal-type moves by 20%. It then changes those moves to Fairy-type.

Name: Plus
Game_Description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When battling with Plus or Minus, Special Attack increases by 50%.

Name: Poison Heal
Game_Description: Restores HP if the Pokémon is poisoned, instead of losing HP.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: HP is restored by 1/8th the maximum HP every turn while the Pokémon has the Poison condition.

Name: Poison Point
Game_Description: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The opponent has a 30% chance of being induced with Poison when using an attack, that requires physical contact, against this Pokémon.

Name: Poison Touch
Game_Description: May poison a target when the Pokémon makes contact.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When the Pokémon attacks its opponents with a move that causes Physical Contact, there is a 30% chance that the target is Poisoned.

Name: Power Construct
Game_Description: Other Cells gather to aid when its HP becomes half or less. Then the Pokémon changes its form to Complete Forme.

Name: Power of Alchemy
Game_Description: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

Name: Power Spot
Game_Description: Just being next to the Pokémon powers up moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases the power of Ally Pokémon's attacks by 30%.

Name: Prankster
Game_Description: Gives priority to a status move.

Name: Pressure
Game_Description: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When this Pokémon is hit by a move, the opponent’s PP lowers by 2 rather than 1.

Name: Primordial Sea
Game_Description: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Fire-type attacks.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Creates the Heavy Rain weather. This lasts until the Pokémon exits battle, and renders Fire-type moves useless.

Name: Prism Armor
Game_Description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Reduces the power of Super Effective moves used against this Pokémon by 25%.

Name: Propeller Tail
Game_Description: Ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon's Abilities and moves that draw in moves

Name: Protean
Game_Description: Changes the Pokémon's type to the type of the move it's about to use.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Before the Pokémon uses a move, it becomes a pure Pokémon of that type.

Name: Psychic Surge
Game_Description: Turns the ground into Psychic Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Activates Psychic Terrain for 5 turns when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Punk Rock
Game_Description: Boosts the power of sound-based moves. The Pokémon also takes half the damage from these kinds of moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases the damage of Sound based moves by 30%. Reduces damage taken by this Pokémon by Sound based moves by 50%.

Name: Pure Power
Game_Description: Using its pure power, the Pokémon doubles its Attack stat.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon’s Attack stat is doubled in battle while having this ability.

Name: Queenly Majesty
Game_Description: Its majesty pressures the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Prevents the opponent from using moves with increased Speed Priority on this Pokémon or its allies.

Name: Quick Feet
Game_Description: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon has a status condition.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Speed is increased by 50% when induced with a status (Burn, Poison, Sleep, Frozen & Paralysis). If Paralysed, the speed drop is ignored.

Name: Rain Dish
Game_Description: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in rain.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: If Heavy Rain weather is in effect, recovers 1/16th max Hit Points at the end of the turn.

Name: Rattled
Game_Description: Dark-, Ghost-, and Bug-type moves scare the Pokémon and boost its Speed stat.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Speed is raised by one stage when the Pokémon is hit by a Bug-type, Ghost-type or Dark-type move or is Intimidated.

Name: Receiver
Game_Description: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Inherits an ally's ability when it faints.

Name: Reckless
Game_Description: Powers up moves that have recoil damage.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The power of moves that have recoil damage is increased by 20%.

Name: Refrigerate
Game_Description: Turns Normal-type moves into Ice-type moves.

Name: Regenerator
Game_Description: Normal-type moves become Ice-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases the power of Normal-type moves by 20%. It then changes those moves to Ice-type.

Name: Ripen
Game_Description: Ripens Berries and doubles their effect.

Name: Rivalry
Game_Description: Becomes competitive and deals more damage to Pokémon of the same gender, but deals less to Pokémon of the opposite gender.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Attack & Special Attack is increased by 25% if the foe is of the same gender; Attack & Special Attack is decreased by 25% if the foe is of the opposite gender.

Name: RKS System
Game_Description: Changes the Pokémon's type to match the memory disc it holds.

Name: Rock Head
Game_Description: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Does not receive recoil damage from recoil-causing damages.

Name: Rough Skin
Game_Description: This Pokémon inflicts damage with its rough skin to the attacker on contact.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The opponent is hurt by 1/8th of his maxium Hit Points of recoil when using an attack, that requires physical contact, against this Pokémon.

Name: Run Away
Game_Description: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Except for trainer battles, can always run from battle. It still cannot switch during Mean Look or Block or when the opponent is trapping with the Arena Trap, Magnet Pull, or Shadow Tag ability.

Name: Sand Force
Game_Description: Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Ground-type, Rock-type & Steel-type moves have their power increased by 33% in a Sandstorm.

Name: Sand Rush
Game_Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a sandstorm.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Speed is doubled within a sandstorm

Name: Sand Spit
Game_Description: The Pokémon creates a sandstorm when it's hit by an attack.

Name: Sand Stream
Game_Description: The Pokémon summons a sandstorm when it enters a battle.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Sandstorm blows when the Pokémon enters battle. As of X & Y, this lasts 5 turns.

Name: Sand Veil
Game_Description: Boosts the Pokémon's evasion in a sandstorm.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Raises the Pokémon’s evasion during a sandstorm by one level.

Name: Sap Sipper
Game_Description: Boosts the Attack stat if hit by a Grass-type move, instead of taking damage.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Attack is raised by one stage when the Pokémon is hit by a Grass-type move. User receives no damage from Grass-type attacks.

Name: Schooling
Game_Description: When it has a lot of HP, the Pokémon forms a powerful school. It stops schooling when its HP is low.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Changes the Pokémon's form when it is Level 20 and has more than 25% Hit Points. When Hit Points drop below 25%, it changes back to Solo Form.

Name: Scrappy
Game_Description: The Pokémon can hit Ghost-type Pokémon with Normal- and Fighting-type moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Allows the Pokémon to hit Ghost-type Pokémon with Normal-type and Fighting-type moves. Blocks Intimidate.

Name: Screen Cleaner
Game_Description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, the effects of Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil are nullified for both opposing and ally Pokémon.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Nullifies effects of Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil.

Name: Serene Grace
Game_Description: Boosts the likelihood of additional effects occurring when attacking.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The chances of a move having a secondary effect is doubled.

Name: Shadow Shield
Game_Description: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Reduces damage inflicted on this Pokémon when at max Hit Points by 50%. It is not affected by moves or abilities that would ignore the ability such as Mold Breaker, Moongeist Beam or Sunsteel Strike.

Name: Shadow Tag
Game_Description: This Pokémon steps on the opposing Pokémon's shadow to prevent it from escaping.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The opponent cannot run nor switch while this Pokémon is in play. The opponent may still switch by using Baton Pass, U-turn or Volt Switch, if it is holding a Shed Shell or is a Ghost-type.

Name: Shed Skin
Game_Description: The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Every turn, it has a 1 in 3 chance of healing from a status condition (BURN, PARALYZE, SLEEP, POISON, FREEZE).

Name: Sheer Force
Game_Description: Removes additional effects to increase the power of moves when attacking.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Moves with a secondary effect are increased in power by 30% but lose their secondary effect.

Name: Shell Armor
Game_Description: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Opponent’s moves cannot Critical Hit.

Name: Shield Dust
Game_Description: This Pokémon's dust blocks the additional effects of attacks taken.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Damaging moves used by the opponent will not have an additional effect.

Name: Shields Down
Game_Description: When its HP becomes half or less, the Pokémon's shell breaks and it becomes aggressive.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Changes the Pokémon into its Core form when its Hit Points drop below 50%. Before then, it cannot be affected by Status Conditions such as Burn or Paralysis.

Name: Simple
Game_Description: The stat changes the Pokémon receives are doubled.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The effectiveness of all stat modifications is doubled.

Name: Skill Link
Game_Description: Maximizes the number of times multi-strike moves hit.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Moves that attack 2-5 times always hit 5 times.

Name: Slow Start
Game_Description: For five turns, the Pokémon's Attack and Speed stats are halved.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Attack and Speed is halved during the first five turns since sent out.

Name: Slush Rush
Game_Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a hailstorm.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Doubles the Pokémon's Speed when Hail is in effect.

Name: Sniper
Game_Description: Powers up moves if they become critical hits when attacking.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Power of critical-hit moves is increased to 225% rather than 150%.

Name: Snow Cloak
Game_Description: Boosts evasion in a hailstorm.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Raises the Pokémon’s evasion during a hailstorm by one level.

Name: Snow Warning
Game_Description: The Pokémon summons a hailstorm when it enters a battle.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Hailstorm blows when the Pokémon enters battle. As of X & Y, this lasts 5 turns.

Name: Solar Power
Game_Description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat in sunny weather, but HP decreases every turn.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: During sunshine, the Pokémon’s Special Attack raises to 1.5 times but HP decreases by 1/8th the maximum HP every turn.

Name: Solid Rock
Game_Description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Damage by super-effective moves is reduced by 25%.

Name: Soul-Heart
Game_Description: Boosts its Sp. Atk stat every time a Pokémon faints.

Name: Soundproof
Game_Description: Soundproofing of the Pokémon itself gives full immunity to all sound-based moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Unaffected by sound moves. If this Pokémon switches out with Baton Pass, Perish Song against the switched out will not be nullified.

Name: Speed Boost
Game_Description: Its Speed stat is boosted every turn.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Speed increases by one stage at the end of each turn.

Name: Stakeout
Game_Description: Doubles the damage dealt to the target's replacement if the target switches out.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Deals double damage to Pokémon switching in.

Name: Stall
Game_Description: The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon always attacks last.

Name: Stalwart
Game_Description: Ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon's Abilities and moves that draw in moves.

Name: Stamina
Game_Description: Boosts the Defense stat when hit by an attack.

Name: Stance Change
Game_Description: The Pokémon changes its form to Blade Forme when it uses an attack move, and changes to Shield Forme when it uses King's Shield.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Changes form depending on moves used.

Name: Static
Game_Description: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity, so contact with it may cause paralysis.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The opponent has a 30% chance of being induced with PARALYZE when using an attack, that requires physical contact, against this Pokémon.

Name: Steadfast
Game_Description: The Pokémon's determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Speed raises by one level every time the Pokémon flinches.

Name: Steam Engine
Game_Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat drastically if hit by a Fire- or Water-type move.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When this Pokémon is hit by a Fire-type or Water-type move, its Speed is increased by 6 stages.

Name: Steelworker
Game_Description: Powers up Steel-type moves.

Name: Steely Spirit
Game_Description: Powers up ally Pokémon's Steel-type moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases the power of Steel-type moves used by this Pokémon by 50%.

Name: Stench
Game_Description: By releasing stench when attacking, this Pokémon may cause the target to flinch.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: If the Pokémon uses a move that deals damage on the opponent, there is a chance the opponent flinches.

Name: Sticky Hold
Game_Description: Items held by the Pokémon are stuck fast and cannot be removed by other Pokémon.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: This Pokémon’s item cannot be taken.

Name: Storm Drain
Game_Description: Draws in all Water-type moves. Instead of being hit by Water-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Water-type moves are drawn to this Pokémon. Water-type moves will do no damage and the Pokémon's SP ATK is raised one stage.

Name: Strong Jaw
Game_Description: The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases the power of biting moves by 50%.

Name: Sturdy
Game_Description: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon will remain with 1 HP if it was going to be knocked out by a move when at full Hit Points, and it is immune to One Hit KO moves.

Name: Suction Cups
Game_Description: This Pokémon uses suction cups to stay in one spot to negate all moves and items that force switching out.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Negates moves that force switching out.

Name: Super Luck
Game_Description: The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Raises the critical-hit ratio of moves by one level.

Name: Surge Surfer
Game_Description: Doubles Speed during Electric Terrain.

Name: Swarm
Game_Description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When HP is below 1/3rd its maximum, power of Bug-type moves is increased by 50%.

Name: Sweet Veil
Game_Description: Prevents itself and allies from falling asleep.

Name: Swift Swim
Game_Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When rainy, The Pokémon’s Speed doubles.

Name: Symbiosis
Game_Description: The Pokémon passes its item to an ally that has used up an item.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Passes the Pokémon's hold item to its adjacent ally when that ally consumes its hold item.

Name: Synchronize
Game_Description: The attacker will receive the same status condition if it inflicts a burn, poison, or paralysis to the Pokémon.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When this Pokémon becomes Poisoned, Paralyzed, or Burned, so does the opponent. However, Fire-type and Water Veil ability Pokémon cannot be Burned, Poison-type and Steel-type and Immunity ability Pokémon cannot be Poisoned, and Limber ability Pokémon cannot be Paralyzed.

Name: Tangled Feet
Game_Description: Raises evasion if the Pokémon is confused.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Pokémon’s evasion raises one level when Confused.

Name: Tangling Hair
Game_Description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Lowers opponent's Speed by 1 stage when the opponent makes physical contact with the Pokémon.

Name: Technician
Game_Description: Powers up the Pokémon's weaker moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Moves with a base power of 60 or less are boosted in power by 50%.

Name: Telepathy
Game_Description: Anticipates an ally's attack and dodges it.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Prevents damage from team-mates during Double and Triple battles.

Name: Teravolt
Game_Description: Moves can be used regardless of Abilities.

Name: Thick Fat
Game_Description: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat, which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Fire and Ice-type moves deal 50% damage.

Name: Tinted Lens
Game_Description: The Pokémon can use â€œnot very effectiveâ€ moves to deal regular damage.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Powers up “not very effective” moves.

Name: Torrent
Game_Description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When HP is below 1/3rd its maximum, power of Water-type moves is increased by 50%.

Name: Tough Claws
Game_Description: Powers up moves that make direct contact.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases the power of moves that make physical contact by 30%.

Name: Toxic Boost
Game_Description: Powers up physical attacks when the Pokémon is poisoned.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Attack stat increased by 50% when Poisoned.

Name: Trace
Game_Description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an opposing Pokémon's Ability.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Ability becomes the same as that of the opponent. Switching this Pokémon out of battle restores its original ability. In a Double/Triple Battle, a random opponent’s ability will be copied.

Name: Triage
Game_Description: Gives priority to a healing move.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Healing moves have +3 Priority when used by this Pokémon.

Name: Truant
Game_Description: The Pokémon can't use a move the following turn if it uses one.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon cannot use a move in the turn following one where it used a move, even if that move failed.

Name: Turboblaze
Game_Description: Moves can be used regardless of Abilities.

Name: Unaware
Game_Description: When attacking, the Pokémon ignores the target Pokémon's stat changes.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Foe’s stat modifications are ignored.

Name: Unburden
Game_Description: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon's held item is used or lost.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Speed is doubled once the held item is consumed.

Name: Unnerve
Game_Description: Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The opponent Pokémon will never use their held Berry while the Pokémon is in battle.

Name: Victory Star
Game_Description: Boosts the accuracy of its allies and itself.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Accuracy for the Pokémon and Allys is raised by 10%.

Name: Vital Spirit
Game_Description: The Pokémon is full of vitality, and that prevents it from falling asleep.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon cannot be Asleep while having this ability.

Name: Volt Absorb
Game_Description: Restores HP if hit by an Electric-type move, instead of taking damage.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon heals up to 1/4 of its maximum Hit Points when hit with Electric-type moves.

Name: Wandering Spirit
Game_Description: The Pokémon exchanges Abilities with a Pokémon that hits it with a move that makes direct contact.

Name: Water Absorb
Game_Description: Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move, instead of taking damage.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon heals up to 1/4 of its maximum Hit Points when hit with Water-type moves.

Name: Water Bubble
Game_Description: Lowers the power of Fire-type moves done to the Pokémon and prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Decreases Fire-type move power on the Pokémon by 50%. Increases power of Water-type moves used by the Pokémon by 100% before adding STAB. Prevents Burn.

Name: Water Compaction
Game_Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Defense stat sharply when hit by a Water-type move.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Increases Defense by 2 stages every time it is hit by a Water-type move.

Name: Water Veil
Game_Description: The Pokémon is covered with a water veil, which prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: This Pokémon cannot be Burned while having this ability.

Name: Weak Armor
Game_Description: Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When hit by an attack, the Pokémon's Defense is lowered by one stage but Speed is increased by two stages.

Name: White Smoke
Game_Description: The Pokémon is protected by its white smoke, which prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Opponents’ moves which lower this Pokémon’s stats have no effect. However this Pokémon may lower its own stats with its own moves.

Name: Wimp Out
Game_Description: The Pokémon cowardly switches out when its HP becomes half or less.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When the Pokémon's Hit Points hit 50% or less, the Pokémon will switch out. Works once per battle. The Pokémon will not switch out if it drops below 50% due to Confusion, Weather, use of Substitute or when the damage inflicted is by a Pokémon with the Sheer Force ability. It will not activate if health is brought back up above 50% due to a hold item.

Name: Wonder Guard
Game_Description: Its mysterious power only lets supereffective moves hit the Pokémon.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: The Pokémon is only harmed by Super Effective damage, weather effects and condition effects.

Name: Wonder Skin
Game_Description: Makes status moves more likely to miss.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: Makes non-damaging moves that are targeted at this Pokémon have the accuracy of 50%.

Name: Zen Mode
Game_Description: Changes the Pokémon's shape when HP is half or less.
Serebii_In_Depth_Description: When Hit Points get to 50% of maximum, the Pokémon changes form. The Pokémon reverts back to its standard form if it loses this ability or returns to over 50% of its Hit Points.
